questions.explanation:
Houdini.

	His father named him for the famous magician. One of the Chicago detectives accused him of naming himself after Harry Potter, and later called him "Gandalf".

questions.text: Tommy Tomm was one of the two people who died in the opening scene. What did he do for a living?
questions.explanation:
Gangster.

	Harry was called in to investigate because their hearts had exploded in their chests. There was no other signs of forced entry or foul play in the hotel room where Tommy and a young college student were found dead.

questions.text: The High Council thought Harry was involved in the deaths of the two people in the hotel room.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Harry was accused of using black magic to kill them. The High Council thought Harry was the only person in the city who was powerful enough to use the spell that had killed them. He cleared himself of the accusations by finding the real killer.

questions.text: What was Ancient Mai doing when Harry met up with her?
questions.explanation:
Eating chicken wings.

	Played by Elizabeth Thai, she was the most powerful member of the supernatural community living in Chicago. She worked for the High Council and order Harry to find the real killer or be held accountable for the murders.

questions.text: Harry admitted to killing his uncle five years before the episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He admitted to killing Justin Morningway in self defense. The High Council still had doubts that it was self defense but couldn't prove otherwise. Dark magic had been used to make the kill.

questions.text: Grace Cutler had died more than a year before the episode. How was she related to the case?
questions.correct: She was a friend of the dead woman.
options: It was her death being investigated.
She hired Harry to investigate the case.
It wasn't revealed in the episode.
questions.explanation:
She was a friend of the dead woman.

	The dead woman, Jennifer Randall, had been a "friend" of the Grace's before her death. She had also been the one to get Grace hooked on drugs which lead to her apparent overdose death. It was later found out to be a death caused by use of black magic.

questions.text: What was the name of the reporter friend Harry called to help him investigate?
questions.explanation:
Susan Rodriguez.

	Susan was an investigative reporter played by Rebecca McFarland. He called her a "friend with benefits" in that he sometimes dated her and sometimes she helped him investigate some of his cases.

questions.text: Harry was attacked by a demon that could turn things to ice.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The demon that attacked Harry and Susan could breathe fire, not turn things to ice. Harry managed to thwart the demon when he summoned lightning and blasted the demon to bits. The High Council also thought that Harry summoned the demon, despite him being the one who was attacked. The demon was played by John De Santis.

questions.text: Who found Harry going through a car with a dead girl inside?
questions.explanation:
Det. Sid Kirmani

	he dead girl was, Linda Atwater, she was also a friend of Grace Cutler's. She was played by Shannon Boodram. Linda, Grace and Jennifer Atwater had all gotten involved with the supernatural during a party at a club owned by a vampire.

questions.text: How was Victor Cutler's body identified after his suicide?
questions.explanation:
Dental records.

	He had apparently shot himself in the head. Cutler had actually faked his own death and started practicing black magic. He was trying to avenge the death of his daughter.
